name: Institute for Understanding Anti-Palestinian Racism
theoryOfChange: The Institute for the Understanding of Anti-Palestinian Racism (IUAPR) bases its work on the 'Anti-Palestinian Racism: Naming, Framing and Manifestations' report by the Arab Canadian Lawyers Association (ACLA). This report serves as a framework that provides a description of anti-Palestinian racism, explains how it operates to silence discourse on Palestine, and outlines its impacts on individuals and the broader community. It is used as a working description and framework for institutions, organizations, companies, and individuals to address incidents of anti-Palestinian racism. The framework details various forms of anti-Palestinian racism, including denying the Nakba, justifying violence against Palestinians, failing to acknowledge Palestinians as an Indigenous people, erasing their human rights, excluding Palestinian perspectives, and defaming Palestinians and their allies.

evaluationSources: UNCORROBORATED: UCSF Institutional Review Board (IRB) approval for research

zakatClaimEvidence: The official website and donation pages of the Institute for the Understanding of Anti-Palestinian Racism (IUAPR) do not explicitly mention 'zakat' or 'zakat donations', nor do they indicate dedicated zakat funds or campaigns. The organization is a U.S. 501(c)(3) tax-exempt non-profit organization focused on research, education, and advocacy to end anti-Palestinian racism. (Source: https://antipalestinianracism.org/donate)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Limited match due to weaker results and/or higher uncertainty; review methodology details before deciding.

zakat.claim_evidence: The official website and donation pages of the Institute for the Understanding of Anti-Palestinian Racism (IUAPR) do not explicitly mention 'zakat' or 'zakat donations', nor do they indicate dedicated zakat funds or campaigns. The organization is a U.S. 501(c)(3) tax-exempt non-profit organization focused on research, education, and advocacy to end anti-Palestinian racism. (Source: https://antipalestinianracism.org/donate)

all_citations.claim: The organization is registered as a nonprofit with programs focused on research, education, and reporting.
The charity accepts general charitable donations (sadaqah) through its online donation portal.
The organization is listed as a Washington, D.C.-based entity with limited financial data available for public rating.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization receives a score of 29/100 due to a significant lack of available financial data and low data confidence. While it addresses an urgent advocacy cause, the absence of program expense ratios and revenue history limits the ability to verify operational efficiency.
areas_for_improvement: Limited public financial transparency and reporting data
Low data confidence due to missing mission statements and financial metrics

dimension_explanations.alignment: With an alignment score of 16/50, the charity addresses an urgent advocacy cause but shows low specific fit for traditional Muslim donor expectations due to a lack of detailed track record [1]. Contributions are categorized as sadaqah-eligible for those interested in general charitable giving toward social justice [2].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization's impact score of 18/50 reflects its focus on capacity building through education and research [1]. However, effectiveness is difficult to measure as specific beneficiary costs and program outcomes are not publicly disclosed in financial filings [3].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Institute for the Understanding of Anti-Palestinian Racism Inc is a specialized nonprofit dedicated to systemic research and advocacy regarding discrimination against Palestinians.
strengths: Specialized focus on research and reporting of anti-Palestinian racism
Provision of educational training programs for public awareness
baseline_narrative.summary: The Institute for the Understanding of Anti-Palestinian Racism Inc operates as a tax-exempt organization focused on research, education, and reporting [1]. Based in Washington, D.C., the organization provides platforms for public education and training to address specific forms of prejudice [3]. Donors can support these initiatives through various digital giving methods hosted on their official platform [2].
